Package projects.spatial.trees

Interface SpatialQuerySolver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    KDTree, PRQuadTree
    public interface SpatialQuerySolver

    SpatialQuerySolver is an interface that declares methods for range and k-NN queries over KDPoints.

    Minor detail: since SpatialQuerySolver is an interface, all of its methods are implicitly public, so the explicit scope modifier is not needed in the source.

    YOU SHOULD ***NOT*** EDIT THIS INTERFACE! If you do, you risk not passing our tests!

    Author:
    Jason Filippou
    See Also:
    KDPoint, BoundedPriorityQueue, SpatialDictionary

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      BoundedPriorityQueue<KDPoint> kNearestNeighbors​(int k, KDPoint p)
      Performs a k-nearest neighbors query on the SpatialTree.
      KDPoint nearestNeighbor​(KDPoint p)
      Performs a nearest neighbor query.
      java.util.Collection<KDPoint> range​(KDPoint p, java.math.BigDecimal range)
      Performs a range query.

    • Method Detail

      • range

        java.util.Collection<KDPoint> range​(KDPoint p,
                                    java.math.BigDecimal range)
        Performs a range query. Returns all the KDPoints whose distanceSquared from p is at most range, INCLUSIVE.
        Parameters:
        p - The query KDPoint.
        range - The maximum distance from p that we allow a KDPoint to have if it should be part of the solution.
        Returns:
        A Collection over all KDPoints which satisfy our query. The Collection will be empty if there are no points which satisfy the query.
        See Also:
        KDPoint, Collection

      • nearestNeighbor

        KDPoint nearestNeighbor​(KDPoint p)
        Performs a nearest neighbor query. Returns the KDPoint which is closest to p, as dictated by distanceSquared(KDPoint p).
        Parameters:
        p - The query KDPoint.
        Returns:
        The solution to the nearest neighbor query. This method will return null if there are no points other than p in the tree.
        See Also:
        KDPoint

      • kNearestNeighbors

        BoundedPriorityQueue<KDPoint> kNearestNeighbors​(int k,
                                                KDPoint p)
        Performs a k-nearest neighbors query on the SpatialTree. Returns the k KDPoints which are nearest to p, as dictated by KDPoint.distanceSquared(KDPoint). The KDPoints are sorted in ascending order of distanceSquared.
        Parameters:
        k - A positive integer denoting the amount of neighbors to return.
        p - The query point.
        Returns:
        A BoundedPriorityQueue containing the k-nearest neighbors of p. This queue will be empty if the tree contains only p.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If k<=0.
        See Also:
        KDPoint, BoundedPriorityQueue
